question: Which countries are covered by the "Afar Triangle"?
explanation: Afar Triangle, also known as the Afar Depression, is a geological depression covered by the Afar region of Ethiopia, Eritrea, and Djibouti. This depression was caused by the Afar Triple Junction of the Great Rift Valley of East Africa. This depression houses the lowest point in Africa, Lake Assal of Djibouti. The northern portion of the depression is known as the Danakil Depression. The Awash River is the main water flow into the Afar Depression region.
